intro: Aleuritopteris gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-sheathed water fern, is a member of the family Pellaeaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive, creeping rhizome with broad, lanceolate fronds that are often divided into segments. Its spores are produced in sori that are clustered on the underside of the fronds. The plant is characterized by its simple, non-branching structure and is often found in temperate regions.
